description:
Nathan Carter: Celtic Country

 

Irish country star Nathan Carter brings his unique blend of Celtic, country, and pop music to Florian Hall in November!

Irish singer Nathan Carter has catapulted into stardom, charming audiences on guitar, piano, and accordion. At age 28, he boasts four number-one albums, two number-one singles, and three number-one live performance DVDs. Join Nathan and his Irish band for a show-stopping mix of songs like “Bridge Over Troubled Water,” “Wagon Wheel,” and a program packed with old country favorites, Irish folk songs, and adult contemporary classics. Fans of Daniel O’Donnell, Michael Bublé, and Tony Bennett will love this young Irish artist who is blazing a trail to worldwide success.
name: Nathan Carter Live In Boston

description:
The Bach Project at Ashmont Hill Chamber Music is delighted to announce its second season of concerts after its sold-out debut in 2017. Under the direction of Andrew Sheranian, this ensemble of professional singers and instrumentalists, drawn from the Handel and Haydn Society, Boston Baroque, Emmanuel Music, Trinity Church in Copley Square, and the Church of the Advent, will perform organ, instrumental, and choral music of Johann Sebastian Bach. They will be joined by the All Saints' Boys Choir. 

Program

Choral, orchestral, and organ works, including

BWV 159 Anh. Motet: Ich lasse dich nicht

BWV 1056: Violin Concerto in G minor                  

BWV 548: Fugue in E minor “The Wedge”                     

BWV 234. Mass in A major
localized_address_display: All Saints Church 209 Ashmont Street, Dorchester, Massachusetts 02124
name: Bach Project

description:
Please join us on Saturday November 24, 2018 at 7:00 pm. This is going to be a great night with music, food, St. Ann and St. Brendan alumni, friends, neighbors and supporters coming together to raise money for our amazing churches.

Since June, members of the Collaborative community have been meeting regularly to work on short term and long term goals including increasing participation and attendance at weekly masses, finding new ways to meet the needs of our diverse community and developing a plan for the coming years. 

We need your help! Our Churches are the cornerstone of our great and thriving communities and are in real need of assistance. So many of us have shared many life events at St. Ann and St. Brendan.

Tickets for this event are $100 per person. 

Please spread the word and get your classmates and friends to join us!
name: The Friends of St. Ann St. Brendan Gala
organizer: Friends of St. Ann St. Brendan

description:
Violinist Tessa Lark, recipient of a 2018 Borletti-Buitoni Trust Fellowship and a 2016 Avery Fisher Career Grant, Silver Medalist in the 9th Quadrennial International Violin Competition of Indianapolis, and winner of the 2012 Naumburg International Violin Competition, is one of the most captivating artistic voices of our time. She has consistently been praised by critics and audiences for her astounding range of sounds, technical agility, and musical elegance. Also the recipient of a career grant from the Leonore Annenberg Fellowship Fund for the Performing and Visual Arts in 2014, Ms. Lark continues to expand her relationships with orchestras and presenters on stages worldwide.​

Program:  TBA
localized_address_display: All Saints Church 209 Ashmont Street, Dorchester, Massachusetts 02124
name: Tessa Lark, violin

description: Tabla virtuoso and Grammy Award-winning member of the Silkroad Ensemble, Sandeep Das celebrates the vibrant cultural heritage shared by India and Syria in his latest project with the thrilling HUM Ensemble. Driving strummed strings, pulsating drums, hypnotic bowed drones, and soaring raga and maqam melodies rooted in Sufi poetry come together to connect ancient civilizations with modern virtuosity in Delhi to Damascus. Das is joined by Syrian oud master Issam Rafea, Indian vocalist and sarangi player Suhail Yusuf Khan, and sitar player Rajib Karmakar to explore centuries of classical and folk music that emerged along the winding trade road from Jaisalmer in India to Damascus in Syria.
localized_address_display: All Saints Church 209 Ashmont Street, Dorchester, Massachusetts 02124
name: Sandeep Das and the HUM Ensemble:  Road to Damascus

description:
Come Join us celebrate our 2nd Annual Festival Navideño/ Christmas Festival

On December 15th, The Puerto Rican Festival of Mass. will continue to help our Victims of Hurricane Maria. One year later and the families now living in Massachusetts that couldn't go back to Puerto Rico are still struggling with the reality of living in the states. As an organization and a community we are having a traditional Christmas celebration with cultural food , music and DJ Michael Mercado from Vincents spinning some modern tunes to help some of these families in need. Tickets are $40 per person - $25 for 16yrs old and under which includes Dinner and live performance . Cash Bar

Tickets sold on day of will not guarantee dinner nor seating but your donation will be appreciated.

For tickets and table purchases please contact me at Prfestivaledwin@gmail.com or buy them on https://www.eventbrite.com

Stay in Contact: https://www.puertoricanfestivalofma.org -https://www.facebook.com/puertoricanfestivalofma

We hope to see you all there WEPA!!!!

Tickets sold on day of will not guarantee dinner nor seating but your donation will be appreciated.

For tickets and table purchases please contact me at Prfestivaledwin@gmail.com or buy them on https://www.eventbrite.com

Stay in Contact: https://www.puertoricanfestivalofma.org -https://www.facebook.com/puertoricanfestivalofma

We hope to see you all there WEPA!!!!
name: Festival Navideño

description: Hub New Music gives the world premiere of a new work by Kati Agócs', commissioned by Ashmont Hill Chamber Music for the ensemble. Praised as “one of the brightest stars in her generation of composers” (Audiophile Audition), Agócs and Hub New Music have enjoyed years of collaboration that began during the ensemble's fledgling seasons at the New England Conservatory (where the composer serves on the faculty).  Additional works on the program by Matthew Aucoin and Judd Greenstein complement Agócs' strikingly lyrical compositional voice.
localized_address_display: All Saints Church 209 Ashmont Street, Dorchester, Massachusetts 02124
name: HUB New Music: world premiere of new work by Kati Agócs
